english_translation: Narrated by Qatadah from Aisha (may Allah have mercy on her), asked about it, she said: Whoever enters into ihram, then his destination is the Ancient House (the Kaaba), meaning it does not end what the muhrim ends. Also narrated from Abu Ma'shar from al-Nakhawi from Aisha: She said I see the black (Kaaba) between the two (narrators), she said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to send with sacrificial animals, and their garlands would be twisted, and he does not refrain from what the muhrim refrains from.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ma'shar from al-Nakhawi from Alqamah from Ibn Mas'ud: He used to send sacrificial animals with Alqamah, and did not refrain from what the muhrim refrains from, then he would order him when it reached its destination to give charity of one third, eat one third, and send to his nephew Abdullah ibn Utbah ibn Mas'ud one third. Also narrated by Qatadah that Ibn Abbas, when he decorated (the animal), he would refrain from what the muhrim refrains from until the animal reaches its destination. Also narrated by Ali ibn Thabit from Nafi' that Ibn Umar used to send sacrificial animals, then he would refrain from what the muhrim refrains from when he decorated the animal, except that he did not make talbiyah.
